Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Disneyfeind
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice. It had hairdryer, iron, fridge, coffee maker. Rooms were clean. Very close to a lot of things. Staff was also very nice and helpful. I wish there were more hotels like this. Especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place for a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl M
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Ramada so many times, I should have a room named after me! Seriously, the management, the staff and the rooms are great, especially for the price. Any time I have had a complaint (nothing major) it has been addressed without delay and always with the utmost courtesy. The beds are great and the room is always clean. I will probably regret posting this and losing availability, but oh well! The folks who work at this hotel deserve it. Thanks Amy! and thanks Curtis.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret!”
Reviews.Author: Robinkennedyoshio
Reviews.Content: What a great surprise to find this diamond in the rough! After coming to San Diego for seven years and always staying at the same few hotels closest to my work I was a bit concerned to be shipped out to a Ramada Inn. Much to my surprise it was way better than the other Comfort Inn and Suites I had been staying in. It has this incredible charm to it that made me feel like I was at a ski resort. The Suites in this hotel were very spacious. Huge might be a word I would use. Frankly you could fit four roll away beds in there if you needed too! There was free breakfast ( not pastries and bagels, but an omelet bar, waffles, fruit...the works!) and free happy hour too! The staff was excellent and the hotel is centrally located. I will defintiely be requesting that my employer send me back to that hotel every time!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: annie8848
Reviews.Content: Not as fancy as the Hampton Inn next door but it was only 69.00 per night where the Hampton was 141.( AAA price). It didn't include the breakfast buffet like the Hampton but it had a nice buffet for 7.99 and remember the room is half the price. The main thing I didn't like was the 25" old style TV where most the more expensive places have the 42"widescreen flatpanel but we only stayed one night and it sufficed. Everything was clean and sparkling which I felt was more important than the tv. Couldn't spot any mold that others have complained about. Bed was comfortable. Had a selection of pillows in different softness. Nice scented soaps and lotions. Shower only, no tub so if you have kids you might think about that. If I was staying more than one night I would probably pay more and have more luxury, but for one night to conserve costs it was fine. We were there to attend a funeral nearby and it was only 5 miles from Miramar National Cemetery.

Reviews.Title: “Mold Alert”
Reviews.Author: shirley m
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a tournament and this 2 day stay wound up causing a huge asthma and allergic reaction. The room was so full of mold that the door had to stay open the entire time while we were there, except when we slept. People who walked by commented that they could smell the mold around the corner. The bathroom had been recently painted to cover the mold but it was poking through before we left. The carpets had mold in them and all they did was sprinkle baking soda over it and re-vacuum. We couldn't leave any earlier because they wanted to charge us to leave. Our mistake. . . we should have just eaten the cost. There were no other rooms available at this hotel, but after 2 nights, the lungs couldn't take anymore. . .We moved to the Holiday Inn Express and it was sooo much better. Don't risk your health if you have allergies or asthma!!! The management wanted to help but the room was too far gone to make a difference. When we checked out they were rude. Better off staying somewhere else, even if it costs more.

Reviews.Title: “It has now been 5 weeks since we stayed at this hotel 1 night but were charged for two! And I still don't have my money back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Happynonni
Reviews.Content: During our stay there, the front desk was so rude! They do not have the continental breakfast that they advertised either!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ssanchez72
Reviews.Content: I just stayed on Sept 19 for 4 days. It is the 2nd time that I stay in this hotel in the past 3 months. I love it because it is quiet & private. The price is right, rooms are very clean and a courteous staff. It is in a central location. If you are looking for an entertainment hotel look some where else. If you are in business travel like I do, you need a quite place where you can turn on your laptop either day or night and work quietly in your room, pool, or any area within the hotel. If you are travelling with your couple it is great too due to the privacy. I LOVE the landscaping specially the bird of Paradise flowers on my window. I made it my place every time I visit San Diego either pleasure, business or both ;)

Reviews.Title: “Didn't like this place...”
Reviews.Author: Brandi P
Reviews.Content: First of all this hotel is not in a very nice surrounding area. The area is covered with gentlemen's clubs, strip clubs and there is even one of "those" stores right down the street. The staff at the front desk was very rude. We asked if they had a continental breakfast and the guy had a horrible attitude when answering us. I mean, he was very rude. The restaraunt looks really nice in the pics, but it's not really a restaraunt, more like a small room. The menu is very limited and they only serve southern food. When we went down to try it out, they were in the process of moving the tables for jazz dancing. No one ever came to take our order or anything, so we finally just got up and left. It states that there are microwaves in every room. Well, we didn't have one in ours. Also, if you stay in an end room, there are only old school shutter glass windows, which let in bugs heat/cold and lots of sound. They don't completely shut so you can literally hear everything. The pool area was nice, the rooms were clean and had quite a bit of space, but we will never stay here again or recommend it to anyone else. This place is not worth the money. Pay $40 to $50 more and stay at Ramada Plaza San Diego Hotel Circle which is much nicer, in a way nicer area and offers a very nice free continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: ratyoke
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week in May 2011. Price was the main reason I chose this hotel. It's a fairly good central location, but there's nothing interesting within walking distance. The room was clean and overall the hotel looked well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Won't Be Back”
Reviews.Author: SoCal1960
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights to attend a family reunion. We were very disappointed with this hotel. To begin with, our room was very hot. We turned on the air conditioner full blast, but our room never cooled off. We tried to change rooms, but all the rooms were taken due to the Comic Con convention in San Diego. The following morning, we bought a fan at Wal Mart, just so we could survive another night. The carpeting in the room was full of stains, the bed was so hard it was like sleeping on a concrete slab. The shower drain was clogged and took about half an hour before the water drained after showering. After being away from the room all morning and afternoon we returned to our room only to find the maid service hadn't even been there yet. We just wanted our towels exchanged and the trash dumped, but we had to ask three times for towels before we finally got them at 4:00 in the afternoon. The nearest ice machine that worked was clear on the other side of the property. For over $300 for two nights, I expect a comfortable room and better service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel! Exactly as advertized!”
Reviews.Author: beckybeanne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ramada for three nights on a family trip to San Diego. The rooms were exactly as advertized online--which can be a rarity when it comes to hotels! The rooms were spacious, the beds were comfortable, the staff was very friendly and helpful, and we felt safe. The hotel is in a great location--close to many restaurants and great shopping. Plus, the rates were very affordable. We'll definitely be back if we visit San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service...would never go back!”
Reviews.Author: capotto
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and made reservations because of a soccer tournament for my daughter. Our arrangements were made with a sales manager who blocked out a group of rooms for the entire team. We clearly stated we would be staying 2 nights and may need to stay a third night based on whether or not the team advanced....the sales manager stated it would be no problem to cancel our room if the team did not advance. When we went to cancel our room as the team had lost, we were told we would be charged for that night anyway. The sales manager obviously has not discussed her promises with the hotel manager and no one really cared. The hotel was dirty and when we turned on the air conditioning unit in our room it smell so horrible like a dead animal was in it or something! I would not recommend staying here at all. The area was sketchy as well with 5-10 adult XXX stores right around the hotel. Not family friendly at all.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Slice of the 1960's”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: As I entered the lobby to check-in, I noticed enlarged full-color retro photos of a 1960's style motel on the wall. A cute accent, I thought, but after observing more of them in the restaurant, I realized they were of this very motel! The owners and management have preserved this property well, changing little of its mid-century modern architecture, while tastefully updating the guest rooms. In fact, the most striking difference from the photos is the guest composition -- a wee bit more diverse in 2011 than 50 years prior! I enjoyed the central courtyard with a pool large by today's standard (8.5 feet deep) and found the breakfast restaurant a welcome change from the normal continental breakfast lobby. As others have pointed out, breakfast is not "free" here; instead, $6.95 will win you an omelet prepared as you wish along with fresh fruit, bacon, hash browns, juice, and a decent selection of cereals and cold items. Best of all, there is no lack of seating or a room full of bleary-eyed guests in night shirts and sweats. The quintessential motor inns of a few decades past are rapidly succumbing to the nondescript boxy structures of today, where parking lots and wifi take the place of flower-filled motel courtyards. For a refreshing taste of yesteryear in a quiet, commercial location, give this one a try.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience Plus”
Reviews.Author: ASW-2010
Reviews.Content: A pleasantly updated clean room with microwave and refrigerator, very comfortable bed, and a great location that allowed getting to any destination fast and easy, made this an ideal fit for my vacation plans. Ample parking, lovely pool, and on site restaurant were additional welcome amenities. Would be delighted to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good for the price”
Reviews.Author: latinavlo
Reviews.Content: great location! Friendly staff. Remodeled but the rooms had a slight old smell, Nice rooms with comfy beds. Lots of pillows, the bathrooms did not match the room; however, they were very clean.Definatley would stay there again. Very quiet area

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded rooms, but motel look exterior”
Reviews.Author: larusaphilp
Reviews.Content: Right off freeway 163, centric. We didn't try the restaurant even though they gave us a 40% discount voucher, free internet. When we got there, we were a little disappointed about the building structure, 2 floor with door rooms facing the parking lot, motel look, but clean and well maintained, also has a nice outdoor pool located in the center of the building. A soon as we enter the room, we changed our minds, room looked great, upgraded and very comfortable, well decorated and spacious.Good service.

Reviews.Title: “Strange rate policy but great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: deabad
Reviews.Content: Our company has put out of town guests into this hotel and they always say their experience is great - they are very happy with everything about the hotel. Excellent location for working in/near UTC or Kearny Mesa areas. Central to everything, yet away from crowds. Mostly quiet except when Miramar jets are practicing -- which is actually fun to watch. However, I think the management and/or front desk staff need to wake up and join their competitors regarding room rate "matching policy." Every time I reserve, the rate quoted by hotel is significantly higher than the rate for same room on hotels.com. Every time, I call the hotel and ask them to match the hotels.com rate. Every time, they refuse. Come on! Most other hotels in San Diego will match rates if you call the property, so not sure why this one property is so stubborn and difficult to work with. For this reason alone, I could only give a rating of "3." Just checked hotels.com and this hotel's internet booking site ... both are same price. I am glad the rate discrepancy has been fixed, and I am upgrading this rating.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, good Breakfast,”
Reviews.Author: adapaoferidu
Reviews.Content: Great for Comic con, it's 10 min.drive away from Qualcom. My 10 year old & I had a decent stay. Listen, it's a 2 star hotel, so don't expect much, but it's clean, with no bugs. There are no interior corridors so all the rooms open to an exterior non secured walkway. Not much in the way of food close by, ya gotta drive 10 or so mins.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Michelle09Australia
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Ramada are very helpful. Our room faced the courtyard and was very pleasant, no noise. We enjoyed happy hour at the bar each evening, free snacks and great people to talk to. The bar staff were exellent, they provided us with tips on where to go, what to see and how to get there. Purchased meals were also great and reasonably priced. This hotel is only a ten minute drive by car to the city and we were able to navigate our way around with ease. Must see places are, Old Town, HMAS Midway & Cardrona Hotel. Thankyou for making our visit and experience to remember.

Reviews.Title: “A little noisy but OK for a quick stay”
Reviews.Author: onbalance
Reviews.Content: The price was right, and location next to the freeway was good. No breakfast included was a big downside. Also, the sound insulation left a lot to be desired. We could hear our neighbors talking, and the outside corridor noise came into the room freely. The aircraft noise from the adjoining Miramar air base also gave evidence to the lack of sound insulation. No on-site gym, and the pool was not heated, but the hot tub was nice. The wi-fi was easy to connect to, and was pretty speedy. The impression I get is that this is pretty much a no-frills business-oriented hotel, not really geared toward families on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: rjw35
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Hotels.com for only $45 per night. It has a pool, hot tub, free internet access (on the computer in the lobby), and free parking. It is very close to a myriad of restaurants within a mile or two. They have a great breakfast for $7 that includes bacon, sausage, cereal, juice, fresh sliced fruit, a waffle station, and a chef for cook to order omelettes. They also gave us a free alcoholic beverage coupon for their bar at check-in (beer or well drink). We had two negatives on our stay that stopped my from giving them a 5 in all categories. First, the pool and hot tub were both closed the 3 days we stayed there, apparently due to all the recent stormy weather. We were on a golf trip with three guys pushing 60 and wanted to hotel with a hot tub to relax sore backs/etc. We would not have booked it had we known the hot tub wouldn't be in service as the hotel was further away from where we wanted to be. When I asked the front desk if we could be compensated in any way (I suggested more free drinks at the bar) they told me there was nothing they could do. We had prepaid for the room and they did offer to refund our money if we wished to go elsewhere. Second, our assigned rooms were facing the freeway. There is a lot of freeway noise in these rooms. Ask for rooms facing away from the freeway if you are a light sleeper. Noise doesn't bother me, but two guys with us had trouble sleeping. If you turn on the air conditioner it helps drown out the freeway noise. These are small complaints as the pool/hot tub problem was just bad timing on our part and the freeway noise is common to many hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: dog4life360
Reviews.Content: The pros: Its only 10minutes from downtown. There are all sorts of stores in the area (Driving distance). The price is right. Beds are super comfy. Rooms are clean. Free parking. Free internet The Cons: NO BREAKFAST. NO REMOTE FOR OUR TV. NO BATHTUB - stand up shower only unless you request a room with a bathtub (No biggy). DEAD MOUSE FLOATING IN POOL (Its outside... [--] happens, but wouldnt touch that water). Next to the highway (but not too loud) All in all if ur looking for a clean place in a good location for a nice price, this is ur place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Cat3lover
Reviews.Content: When we walked into our room I felt like we were at a 5-star resort! The room was really nice! Clean! Nice linens on the bed! Wood headboard! Fluffy towels! Large bathroom with shower! Nice desk with outlets! Outlets on the night stand! (My husband has sleep apnea. We usually have problems with outlets for his C-PAP machine! Not here!) The pool and hot tub area were very nice. The grounds are well maintained. Breakfast is not included but they do offer a breakfast buffet every day for 6.95>

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient.”
Reviews.Author: mmmm1982
Reviews.Content: I've never stayed at Ramada before and thought that this would be another cheap motel among all the other INNs you can find on every corner in every city. I was pleasantly surprises with the size and interior of the room. More than that if it says NO SMOKING it means NO SMOKING - there was no smoke odor inside and housekeeping kept it very clean on daily bases. This particular Ramada is located right at the intersection of two major highways in San Deigo, but you couldn't hear any traffic noise inside and it was conveniently located within minutes drive from all the major local attractions. The absolute best part about it is there's a fridge and a microwave in the room! Free WiFi too.

Reviews.Title: “For the price a great option”
Reviews.Author: cknieto
Reviews.Content: We went to SD for 5 days and i really like this hotel, good size rooms with microwave and fridge, i read some reviews that the shower water pressure was low but its not really that bad, good service, the breakfast buffet really really good and for a good price, location its not bat, its not near downtown but its just around the corner from the freeway so u are at downton in less than 10 minutes and its about 10 min from the qualcomm stadium (we went to the dolphins game), the only bad think was that the wireless internet was down in my room but the internet service at the lobby works for me.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: jrleeper
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't bad for the price. I'd say that the inside needs an update. The grounds are nice as well as the pool and jacuzzi. We were happy with the breakfast buffet and it was reasonably priced at under $7.00 with a variety of food. Another plus is that the room had a microwave, fridge & hair dryer. Didn't get to enjoy the bar because it (as well as the pool) closed at 9:00 which I thought was early. I was looking forward to hanging out and enjoying a few drinks. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Location is great - near freeway, gas, and food. Stopped at a nearby grocery store - Ranch Market - and thought we were back in Japan. Pretty much only Asians in the store with only a handful of Caucasians. Great variety of food if that's what you like (and we like). They had tanks with live carp, tillapia, crab & catfish. Their deli was awesome. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “FREQUENT STAYS AT HOME AWAY FROM HOME”
Reviews.Author: mkyaskin
Reviews.Content: Have been staying at this Ramada since 1999. It's a great place, great people, great atmosphere and with a good food/drinks. Like sitting at home in your den. Relaxing and full of good conversation or just sit back and watch your favorite sports on the variety of screens they have in the bar. If you're a government traveler it has the best government program in town, just ask for Kiami. Mike

Reviews.Title: “Friendly people fun stay”
Reviews.Author: Ilikefood36
Reviews.Content: Loved the feeling of the grounds and the pool. Kids had a great time at the pool with other families. Room was clean, semi updated, comfortable. Because of the pool and hot tub, I did not miss having a tub in my room. Aside from the occasional F-14 (kids thought it was cool) it was very relaxing. Many rooms were getting updated during our stay. Great central location between all parks and beaches.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and resort setting”
Reviews.Author: mike10California
Reviews.Content: The staff and level of service exceeds all I have found

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & Great Price for my Family”
Reviews.Author: AzIceQueen
Reviews.Content: There was five of us My mom, me, and my 3 kids ages 9, 4, & 2. I was surprised by how great the hotel turned out to be. I booked the hotel then I read the reviews. I saw a lot of bad reviews and thought I had choosen the wrong hotel. When we got there the front desk person was very friendly. I asked about resturaunts nearby and they gave me options and even gave me a menu for a Mexican resturaunt they recommended. The room was nice. It did have just a shower but I don't take baths in hotels so that was fine with me. My little ones 2 & 4 year olds even enjoyed the shower and they take baths only at home. I didn't hear anything thru the walls or above us (we were on the bottom floor). Didn't have any complaints from anyone around us about our noise level. The pool looked beautiful too but was too cold for us to go swimming. We didn't try the onsite Proud Mary's the prices were a bit steep for out budget since I had the kids with me and they don't always eat all their food. I did have to call because we hadn't gotten the microwave I requested when we checked in. They brought it within 5 minutes of my call. I would definately recommend this hotel it was great for me and my family.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: mitan
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean rooms. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Jolobean
Reviews.Content: On a 2 week tour of California from the UK this was our first stop; and what a great start! The staff were friendly and always ready to help out with maps and driving instructions to local attractions. There was lots of parking. The room was clean, it was relatively recently decorated and the beds were comfortable; nothing fancy but we got what we expected. Although right next to the pool our room was quiet although like most of the hotels we stayed at in this price range the walls were thin and perhaps later in the season it might not have been quite so peaceful. The grounds were beautifully maintained and the pool and hot-tub a great hit with the children (10 & 7). Breakfast (not included in the basic price) can be highly recommended. Not so Broadway Pizza, recommended in the rooms but delivery was far too slow. Although our San Diego friends expressed surprise at the "non-touristy" location, both the zoo and Seaworld were only a comfortable 15 minute drive away; I'd accept the slightly out of town location for the price discount any day. A thoroughly good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms and excellent customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Coolit48
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ramada During Easter Weekend. The rooms were clean, the staff provided anything extra needed. The rooms were large and the beds very comfortable. The restuarant had good food and reasonable prices but the location was the best part of it. Close to downtown nightlife, the ocean and lots of great restuarants. The customer service from the staff was excellent and it was very quite and well kept up. Would stay there again and recommend it to others for the price, you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: havefuninsd
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend was coming to San Diego and we needed a place to stay for the night. The room was nice and clean. It wasn't a busy weekend so it was very quiet. For the price, this is well worth the stay. I would definitely come back here. The front desk was very helpful and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Older but Nice Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Skorzy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a couple nights over Halloween weekend. We originally used Travelocity to find affordable hotels in the area, and found this Ramada at the perfect midpoint between our destinations at $65/night. Excellent price and the reviews were generally favorable. I went directly to the hotel's website and booked there to avoid agency fees. This was painless and it was the same reasonable price. Getting to the hotel was very easy. Parking is acceptable and apparently very safe. The front desk people were efficient and functionally friendly, which is precisely how I like it. I am not real fond of overly talkative front desk people. Courtesy and efficiency are my two requirements, and this hotel had them. The hotel's layout is one of an older property built in the 70's, having a "garden style" layout. It was kind of nice to have a walkway near a lawn and lots of greenery. We were at first worried because we were given a first floor room right next to the housekeeping laundry room! Fortunately that was never a problem and noises from that place were minimal. The room was reasonably spacious and the furnishings didn't look as old as the hotel itself. First quirk was there was no switch near the entrance to turn on a light! The king sized bed was a pillowtop, though my side of it had a slight mattress sag in it, but not enough to be upset about. Pillows were very nice and more supportive than your typical one. The work desk was a joke. It had a huge office chair that was nearly larger than this desk itself! Just looked odd. The TV cabinet was also on the small side. There was a BIG sliding door closet with mirrored doors which you'd expect to see in a home, not a hotel. The bathroom was amusing. The toilet area had its own alcove, as did the shower, with the sink in the entrance area. We were making jokes about finding a minotaur in this maze! The worse part of this room was the shower. It was a standup shower with no tub. First, the shower area was a bit small for me, second, the showerhead had very little pressure and set low so tall people like myself would have to kneel to get water on your head. Showering was bordering on annoying because of these two things! My much smaller girlfriend said she had no problem.. so this is not a room for tall people! (I'm only 6' 1") Generally.. the hotel was VERY quiet, one of the quietests ones I've ever stayed in, and that was fantastic! There were plenty of other guests, so the solitude wasn't because of the place being empty. Be careful and wary of hotel taxes and fees tacked on to your bill when you book the place. Get your final price before reserving. My bill was about $8/night higher because I had *thought* the $65/night included these taxes. Read the small print. Overall, I'm pleased with the experience for the price I paid, though I would seriously shop around next time I'm in the area. The poor water pressure and cramped shower stall would have me looking at other properties first, but I wouldn't avoid this place if they had the best deal going.

Reviews.Title: “MAGNIFICENT A MUST STAY”
Reviews.Author: willywallywish
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been travelling the States and Canada for 6 weeks and staying at 2-5 class hotels. This is the best yet. I love this place. I love the rooms as they are spacious, they have nintendo setup on the tv for the kids, a fridge and I just love the layout of the hotel. The pool and spa is to die for. Oh and this is the best yet... they make dinner for just $8.95 pp or $6 for the kids by the poolside and the food was DELICIOUS! Free soda drinks for the kids as well. It's a bargain and a must. I really like the fact that it's right off the 163 freeway easy to go anywhere. It took us 25 min to get to the Mexico border. The service is the best as well, friendly and frontdesk telephoned me in my room after we booked in. This gets a big 5star rating from me. I'll be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: jreelfs
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have stayed in. Although it's not the nicest hotels around it is really good. I stay here almost every two weeks and have yet to be disappointed. My most recent stay was in there King size room and little by little they are remodeling all the rooms in the hotel. This time I had the remodeled room and it looked amazing. The t.v worked great and the room was really clean. I have had the two queen bed room before also, very nice room. Although a little cramped still pretty nice. Rooms in the first few buildings are a little outdated but they are working on that. They have a standard suite which is usually pretty clean and comfortable. It's nice because it has a large king bed with a sofa sitting area. It has a small kitcknette with just a sink and a counter area. They also have a deluxe suite which you can usually find through hotels.com . The nice thing about the deluxe suite is the room is really large. It has a sitting area, and although the its a studio suite and everything is in the same room its very spacious. The kitchen in this room is very nice because it has to range burners. Overall this hotel is one of my favorite. I wouldn't pay anything over 100 for it though. I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a nice hotel for not a lot of money. Oh and the area is really nice. The breakfast is amazing although a little pricy. If you book directly through the hotel with the AAA rate they give you a voucher for a free breakfast in the morning.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Puerto Penasco and Rosarito Beach, Mexico
Reviews.Title: “Thank goodness for the pool area”
Reviews.Author: MichelleHerbison
Reviews.Content: First off we booked this hotel after looking at tripadvisor and Hotels dot com, but we decided to contact them direct. Pior to our arrival we phone the hotel to ask what time we could check in and we were told that we could check in at the time, our phone converstation was a little skecty. Check in was really fast and very friendly service! Our room could have been better...but at the same time it could have been worse. Opon opening the door there was a lot of grass clippings on the carpet, luckily the housekeeper was just a room over so we asked her to vaucum and she did it with out any problem. The desk, armoire and bed side tables had huge nicks and worned out. The mini fridge was not turn on so at first we thought it was broken. The bathroom door looked as though it has been in a fight and lost...there were large patch holes and after our two day say a corner of the door feel off. I was really looking forward to a tub and was shocked to only see a shower. The good thing about the room is that it had an oversized closet, a really large bathroom. and it was very clean. The wireless internet was very easy to conect to. The hotel was in a very good area, very close to everything we never were more than 10 miles from the attrations of the Zoo and Sea World. After two days of walking all over the parks it was wonderful to come back and soak in the hot tub and swim in the pool. I gave this hotel a neutral rating beacuse that is just how I felt there was nothing terrible about the hotel, and certainly nothing excellent either.

Reviews.Title: “Outrageous credit card funds withholding policy at Ramada”
Reviews.Author: vistalady
Reviews.Content: BEWARE - BEWARE - BEWARE This hotel, unlike any hotel I have ever stayed at, has a policy that they say their "owner" instituted that REQUIRES that your credit card be charged $50 per night for what they believe might be "incidental" charges. They will not guarantee when you will get your money and say they don't know. Could be 7 days, could be 10 days. Who knows? The clerk kept pointing to the fact that it was my fault because I booked online and that hotels.com could not be trusted and that they lie. Hotels.com assured me I had a solid reservation with a king-sized bed. When I reached the hotel, they didn't even know I was coming and found the reservation in their fax machine. They said they "would see" if there were any rooms available. so much for making a reservation, huh? We all are certainly aware of hotels having your card info and, upon checkout, reconciling your bill and if there are extra charges, they are put on your bill. But to take your $50 upfront for no reason is absurd. They will tell you that there is some fine print somewhere that warned you that "other charges might apply." And to that I say: CROOKED. Keeping your money and earning interest on it at a rate of $50 PER RESERVATION, you can only imagine how much money they make on that alone. I refused to stay there and insisted my reservation be cancelled through hotels.com and that I have the charge backed off my card for my reservation and was told by the agent, who is in India, they would cancel but it would take approximately 30 days to get my money back for my reservation. Ridiculous. I will never, ever stay at a Ramada Inn because of their deceptive practices. I also will never use hotels.com.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this place”
Reviews.Author: carebee21
Reviews.Content: Stay away from this hotel. This is one of the most deceitful hotels I've stayed in. We booked our hotel for $269.00 (there were tons of things in town so the prices were sky high, as was this hotel) We came and checked in and everything seemed fine at check in. The guy was nice and friendly. We get to our room, and everything changed. The room smells awful. It smells like a combo of old stale smoke and paint. Our room looks nothing like the pictures. The furniture is not the same, it's a tiny chest at the foot of the bed with drawers, and then the tv is on a small end table looking thing. Certainly not the amoire shown in the pic. I go in the bathroom and there's not a bathtub (even thought the pics on the website show a bathtub) So I call the front desk. There are limited amounts of rooms with bathtubs and those were gone. So instead, we have this tiny shower in a corner that was dirty. So then we go to the spa. That was the only area that was the same as the pics. The pool was freezing cold so we skipped that but the spa was nice and clean. The jets don't work very well, but after a long day of walking around the zoo, just sitting in the hot water felt nice. That area is also very well kept, and nice looking. Then we tried to go to sleep, but the jets flying all night made that difficult. The next morning we go to get our free continental breakfast as advertised on the website and we were told they only have coffee. But on the website they show a whole breakfast room and everything. So I ask the clerk and he says, Oh I know the website says that, but I don't know why, we've never had continental breakfast here. So if you've never had it, why would you have a picture of it on your website and offer it??? False advertising? The sign on the back of the door, with the fire escpae and rate info says the max for this room is $159, but like I said, we booked for $269, but again, the front desk didn't have an explanation for that. Our air conditioner didn't work. Neither did the fridge or the bedside lights. So again, stay away. This hotel is shady and deceptive.

Reviews.Title: “Wireless internet worked great”
Reviews.Author: Skywest199
Reviews.Content: 6-night stay Feb 13-19, 2008 We booked a great bargain package at Expedia and I had read the reviews of this hotel before we left, so I knew we weren't going to the Ritz. I run an internet business and the most important thing to me was that the wireless would work. It performed fine. Was able to connect within 10 minutes of checking in. That said, the room was freshly painted...like maybe completed the day before and while that meant everything was clean and shiny...it smelled terrible the whole time we were there. There were no other rooms available to move to either. We had 2 queen beds, which after alternating for 2 nights, we stacked the mattresses on top of each other and made it tolerable. The staff was great. Room was cleaned in a timely manner everyday. There was never any disturbing noise at night during our stay. Would I stay there again? Maybe if the paint smell had gone away!

Reviews.Title: “Needs some definite work”
Reviews.Author: E-TripCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a Christmas party, but I wouldn't stay here for any other reason. The place needs serious internal and external work. Lights didn't work on one side of the room, there were some strange smells, and the carpet wasn't in the best shape. Bed and shower were fine, though. Front desk staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Ramada Inn - Kearny Mesa - not safe for women traveling alone”
Reviews.Author: AustinTrainer
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't clean, it's out dated and not safe for women traveling alone. Doors only have the lock on the door handle and the little chain that hooks from the wall to the door. I could see through the door crack into the parking lot. Doors open right up to the parking lot and it doesn't appear to be a real safe area.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I had booked a different hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Akalliecat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ramada Inn Conference Center Qualcomm Stadium for 3 nights. When we made our reservation via Hotels.com, we requested a smoking room and when we arrived at the hotel, I asked the gentleman at the Front Desk if our room was smoking and he said yes, that it was he even told another guest in the lobby that the hotel was smoker friendly. When we got in the room, it smelled like smoke but we did not see an ashtray. Since we were advised that this was a smoking room, and we were so exhausted when we arrived, we figured that the maid had not left one on accident. We just used an ashtray that we had bought as a souvenier. The rooms were older and need to be updated and we had trouble with the toilet stopping up the entire time we were there. They sent maintenance a few times to plunge the toilet and the maintenance man saw us smoking and didn't say anything to us as did the maid. When we had checked in they asked for a credit card for incidentals and said there would be a $30.00 hold placed on the card. When we checked out, they said that we were fine and didn't owe anything and advised that the $30.00 hold would be released on our card. Two days after we checked out, I discovered that they had charged us $100.00! I called the hotel and a lady told me that she was the only one at the hotel and promised that she would check to see what the charge was for and would for sure call me back as soon as another employee came in. After waiting 4 hours, I decided to call back and to my surprise, she had left for the day (That is HORRIBLE Customer Service!). The lady I spoke to knew nothing about my situation and said she was the only one there at the time (sounds like they need to hire some more employees) and would try to check into it and call me back. She actually did call back and told me that we had been charged $100.00 for smoking in a non smoking room. I was in shock and explained everything to her but she was rude and started argueing with me about it. She said that the lady I needed to speak to (the one who "promised" to call me back) would not be back until Tuesday (this is Saturday) and she would be the one I would have to discuss this matter with. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone and will not be staying there ever again! Plus they need to update their driving directions that they hand out to hotel guests as they are all wrong and we got lost several times using them.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: CADreamin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as it was close to relatives we were visiting. Having been in this area before, I was not about to chance staying in an "unknown" hotel (I wanted a "well known" chain). The price we paid for the room was great (about $88/night ... on a weekend), especially since the room was comfortable and clean. We didn't have any neighbors so I can't comment on how thin or thick the walls were; however, we could hear people milling out by the swimming pool, which was outside our door. BTW, the pool area was very nice. We had to pay for our breakfast, which was a buffet. The food was good but, considering everything, I felt that breakfast should have been included with our room (it would have been a nice "plus"). The hotel is close to some decent restaurants (i.e., Shogun Kobe [very nice], Stewart Anderson's Black Angus [which was okay], The Butcher Shop Steakhouse [which I understand is very good], and The Godfather Restaurant [great old-style Italian food]). When staying in this area again, I will probably check out the Hampton Inn, which is right next door to the Ramada; however, if the price isnâ€™t â€˜rightâ€™, we may be visiting the Ramada again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellers7
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights when in San Diego in April for a getaway. We arrived and was greeted by Micheal on reception who was fantasic very helpful and funny. The check in was smooth and efficent we got a room at the front of the hotel overlooking the pool which was nice. The room was large and bed comfortble and we had a bath with a shower over it, The room was clean and maid service everyday. We weren't in the room very long as out doing things most days but was nice enough for when we were there. I dared to try the pool as people had said it was freezing and YES!! It was freezing but I managed to brave it and had a swim, I also tried out the jacuzzi which was lovely. In other reviews it stated you could hear everything through the walls well I have to say we didnt hear a peep except when people slammed their room doors. The hotel was situated in a convenient location and next to the freeway so easy to get to downtown San Diego (about 10-15mins drive). There was loads of resturants nearby and Dennys was just the other side of the freeway which was great as love the place. Micheal gave us a compiled list of resturants when checked in that we could check out unfortunetly we could only do so many as such a short time there, but ones we did try were nice ----- TIP: The soup plantation is great value for money and really nice food - all you can eat buffet for $8.99. We didn't check out the hotels resturant as we like to eat out when on holiday and see the different sights so can't comment on this but has got kareoke on wednesday nights. The only complaint I have is that on that night when arrived home from being out for dinner we only just managed to park the car in the carpark by our room as was full from people coming from all over (assuming locals) to the kareoke. Overall this hotel was a good choice for the money and I would deffinately reccomend to my friends and would deffinately stay again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: neptunebutch
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff is very professional and helpful. Whatever it was that I needed they complied. The rooms are a little dated but I wasn't there to hang in the room, I was there on vacation and to visit my daughters. (who also stayed with me) The cleaning staff was very efficient and polite. I left the room in the morning and always came back to clean sheets and towels. The AC worked maybe a little too good and the one night we needed heat it was there. The hotel is centrally located to most major attractions in the area and had no problems getting around. It just took a while to get use to the fact that the ocean is on the other side. I reccomend that you try not to get a room in the back part of the hotel, it was a little noisy the first night I was there and they seem to put the more active type persons in that area. They did move my room the next morning to the area right by the pool and hot tub. The hot tub was great, not over clorinated and my girls told me the water in the pool was just a tad cold, since it's not heated. Then again it was February. The restaurant on the other hand left a little something to be desired. It is not kid friendly food although the kids ate, then again they were starving. There is a great breakfast place named COCO's right up the road and I only wished the woman behind the front desk had told me about it before my last day. Best breakfast I had on my whole trip!!!! All said, it was what I paid for and I would go back there again. (and no, I don't work for Ramada).

Reviews.Title: “Better for business travelers than vacationers”
Reviews.Author: scoopcath
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for four nights over Christmas. My mother lives about 5 minutes away, and booked the hotel for us. We usually stay at hotels on Hotel Circle, which is 5 minutes away from her house in the other direction. As I recall, one year another hotel even left us a Christmas present, including a stocking full of goodies. This hotel did not even offer housekeeping on Christmas day. We were promised a breakfast each day, but did not realize that breakfast ends at 9:00 am. We were on vacation, and slept in until around 8 am. By the time we got around to the dining room, breakfast was over. We did make it to breakfast one day. It was decent. They made a nice omelette fresh in the pan. The room was fine. There was a desk with one chair. When we brought in dinner one night, we took turns sitting at the desk to eat. They do offer free coffee in the lobby, but to save time one morning, we used the in-room coffee maker. Wow, what a mess! It leaked water all over the place. There was plenty of parking most days, but it did fill up at night. The shower head was quite low- tall husband had to bend in uncomfortable positions. Surprisingly quiet- close to freeway. I would not stay here again. I would stay at any number of Hotel Circle locations.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as they say”
Reviews.Author: Staplewoman
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and average. The bathroom was very clean and we had no problems checking in or even finding a taxi service to get us to the stadium. Front desk receptionist was very helpful and gave us options on what was in the area (both food and attractions). I look forward to staying again. The only bad thing was they want you to check out promplty. Other than that, it was a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: LA_County_Mom
Reviews.Content: Our reservation had been made by another person in our large group, and I was apprehensive about staying here after reading prior reviews. But, our two night stay at the beginning of August went smoothly. Access from freeway was convenient. My two children and I were assigned a 1st floor room of the "Executive Wing" facing Kearny Mesa Rd. It was clean and comfortable, and pretty quiet, except for the occasional loud bang from slamming doors from neighboring rooms. The room rate for our group included a simple breakfast buffet both mornings which was okay. Both the coin laundry facilities and pool appeared to be heavily used from the time they were open in the morning until the time they were locked for the night. All staff I encountered, from front desk to maintenance to housekeeping, were polite, cheerful and helpful. Although it won't be my first choice, I will consider staying here again if another sporting event brings us to this part of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Henrik22
Reviews.Content: What an odd place this is! We (2 adults and 2 teenagers) had booked and paid our room in advance, got to the hotel, checked in and got a key to a room ... only to find out that the room was already occupied by someone else!!!! We went back to the reception and had to wait the longest time while the totally uncommitted staff looked for another room for us - and finally we were offered an "upgrade" to a suite. This meant that we needed two extra beds in the room because it only had one double bed ... and we got the lousiest extra beds with totally worn out mattresses, and then the people in the reception wanted us to pay for one of the extra beds! What an "upgrade" to be offered by the staff. Of course we protested and finally managed not to have to pay any more for the needed four beds we had already paid for. Aside from the not very helpful staff (if you go here, ask for Michael in the reception - he was the only truly helpful and nice person at the hotel, but unfortunately he wasn't there when we checked in), the air-condition was incredibly loud and excess water from it was running all over the place outside the room, the clientele at the hotel consists mostly of business people and truck drivers needing an overnight stay (on the positive side this meant that we had the pool almost to ourselves at all times ...), and the hotel's location is just not very good - you're simply too far away from everything San Diego has to offer, even when you have a car (which is necessary in this area). If this hotel wants to have a future, the staff surely needs to put on a more accomodating attitude so you actually feel welcome when showing up ... and some needed improvements as to the beds and the air condition would help a lot too. But my best recommendation is: Find somewhere else to stay, it's just not worth it to stay at this place.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: lfcreamer
Reviews.Content: Old motel in need of remodeling. Spend a little more and stay somewhere else! Advertised as "non smoking room" yet room reeked of cigarettes!

Reviews.Title: “Nasty!”
Reviews.Author: Caribe-2
Reviews.Content: I only spent one night here--but it will be my last. The bathroom and floor were filthy. I did not check this out right away as I should have. I kept my shoes on and took a sponge bath in the morning. The heat did not work and there were no extra blankets (I discovered this when I was already in bed). The only ok thing was a thick pad was placed on the bed under the sheet, so the bed was fairly comfortable--but it rattled whenever I moved. I did try to view the room before I took it, but they made me pay first(after telling me they could not verify the government charge card the reservation was made with). Not a pleasant experience at all.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a weeknight to get some desperately needed sleep from a daily commute totalling 4 hours (stayed here one night so as not to have to commute home). All I really wanted to do was sleep. My first interruption came at 10:30pm when someone was pounding loudly on my door - being by myself (and a female), I looked discretely out the window and saw a taxi cab waiting outside my room. I did not open the door, but the cab was outside for about 15 minutes and I couldn't fall back asleep until I was sure it had left. At 1:30am, I was awakened by the sound of people talking loudly and walking back and forth on the upstairs walkway - the walls are very thin in these rooms. Then, at 2:30am, the phone rang (very loudly), but no one was there. Again, I couldn't immediately fall asleep. I had to get up at 5:00am and was tired from all the disruptions. The room descriptions given by others are accurate - the room is small with thin walls, the carpet is very worn, the shower is super tiny. For the price, it isn't too bad, but it's not too nice either. Definitely wouldn't want to stay for more than a night.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: marcjenks
Reviews.Content: Every Hotel/Motel should put the most into the mattress quality. That's the #1 thing I check for each time I stay somewhere. In our 2 queen, one was newer and too firm, and the other was worn out and sagging. When I find a place with great beds, I never go anywhere else in that town. We will try somewhere else next time, but the deal was great at $71/night for 3 nights. It's cheaper, because its 5 miles north up the 163 from Hotel Circle. The staff was perfect. They resopnded to our every need. They offered to change our rooms to the newer ones, but we were settled in already. We asked for a microwave and got it (no chg). The grounds are very well kept (in a mom & pop sort-of-way). The older rooms (Building A, B, C, or D) are huge, and we chose them over the newer, smaller rooms in Building E with newer mattresses (only because we were already unpacked). Look out for this: A, B, C, D have only a 3x3 shower; while E has shower/bathtubs (same price). The walls in 240 were thin enough that my wife and I were given an awakening performance by our next door neighbors. We didn't use the pool, but it was heated and looked great. The summary: If your San Diego budget is below $100/night, this is a great pick. You need a car if you stay here, which is okay, it is still only 5 extra minutes to Sea World, Zoo, beaches, harbor, etc. This is a great ** (2 star), but a stretch at *** (3 star).

HotelInfo.Name: Ramada Inn and Conference Center Qualcomm Stadium
HotelInfo.Address: 5550 Kearny Mesa Rd, San Diego, CA 92111
